comment._content: The Herald was an important newspaper that later merged to become the New York Herald-Tribune. The Herald didn't have a patent on this device; a Google search of "Playograph" discovers that they were used by newspapers in numerous towns across the country -- often inside a theater, with an admission charge. Here is a football version, called a "Grid Graph," from 1923: www.flickr.com/photos/70251312@N00/2298930159/
